snippet: Senator Charles E. Schumer criticized a proposal to lower top tax rates but still raise revenue, complicating efforts to reach a deficit-reduction deal before January’s “fiscal cliff” takes effect.
abstract: Sen Charles E Schumer of New York criticizes bipartisan proposal to lower top tax rates but still raise revenue, complicating efforts to reach a deficit-reduction deal before January 2013, when the 'fiscal cliff' of tax increases and automatic spending cuts takes effect.
lead_paragraph: Senator Charles E. Schumer criticized a proposal to lower top tax rates but still raise revenue, complicating efforts to reach a deficit-reduction deal before January’s “fiscal cliff” takes effect.

headline.seo: Schumer Speech on Taxes Shakes Up Deficit Talks
headline.main: Schumer Shakes Up Deficit Talks With Call to Raise Taxes on the Rich
headline.print_headline: Schumer Shakes Up Deficit Talks With Call to Raise Taxes on the Rich
